head.title: Life Under the Billboard Blanket; 'Not So Residential' Area Heard From

hedline.hl1: Life Under the Billboard Blanket; 'Not So Residential' Area Heard From

block.p: Re ''Workers Night-Shift Socializing Disturbs Sleep Shift'' (April 16): Steven Schecter of the M.T.A. describes our Tenth Street block as ''not so residential.'' Perhaps he can explain what the sum total is of our mixed housing, which includes single-family homes, yards, trees, driveways and potted geraniums if not ''residential''? How many people are required to consider a neighborhood residential enough to merit nights and early mornings free from disturbance?
CAROLINE N. BROWN Park Slope, Brooklyn
